oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Oral Meloxicam on Performance and Health of Stocker Calves after Castration
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Coetzee, J. F.
Edwards, L. N.
Mosher, R. A.
O'Connor, A. M.
KuKanich, B.
Blasi, D. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: castration
average daily gain
NSAID
stocker calves
surgical castration
meloxicam
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Castration in weaned calves is stressful and affects profitability by reducing average daily gain (ADG) and increasing susceptibility to disease. This study investigated the effect of meloxicam, a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), on performance and health of stocker calves after surgical castration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 141
